column4: has anyone configured his 7/10 button mouse so that forward/backward works in firefox?
yes, use xbindkeys and xvkbd to map them to ALT+LEFT and ALT+RIGHT.  What mouse do you have by the way?
logitech cordless click plus. the button 6 and 7 also send button 2/3 events.
any idea why those would send 2 button events?
hrmm, what does your xorg.conf look like?
http://paste.ubuntu-nl.org/7452  is the relevant xorg.conf part
can you use usb?  the evdev protocol might handle it better
wait you are :), but it's conencted to usb right?
I do't know if it matters but my xorg looks like this: Option          "Protocol"              "evdev"
well worth a try. can you look what xev gives you as button events on the thumb buttons?

my mouse like to sends multiple signals because of 'smartscroll' functionality (not for side buttons).  I can disable it using a program called 'lmctl'... I have no idea if it is something similar to what you are getting.  Does increasing or reducing the number of buttons fix the problem at any point (just to see)?
nope. with 4 or 5, it just doesnt get any event. with more than 10 i havent tried
on that wiki page, that's how I set mine up.  It is basically like yours except I have zaxis mapping with 4 entries
yeah, it just seems strange.  Because for mine, the 2 signals make sense.  But I don't think it would make sense to send 2 signals with one of them being right click
yeah, I noticed that changing that modified how key reacted for me a lot
